website_summaries.verdict: Ensures your baby is seated in an ergonomic "M" shape position with knees even to or above the hips, and the spine in a curved "C" position.
pros: Offers incredible lower back support with a wide, wraparound waistband
Easily adjusts to fit multiple wearers
Made from 100% cotton and machine washable
cons: The hook-and-loop waistband is loud and hard to adjust once it's on

customer_reviews.title: The carrier works great for him
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves to use this; I rarely use it. Why? He is over 6 feet tall; I'm 5' 4". The carrier works great for him; It is too long on my body and either the baby's head is hitting my chin constantly or strapped around my legs instead of my back- it is a long and big carrier,e ven with adjustments made. So, I only gave it four stars instead of five. However, Daddy and son do enjoy using it and it is helpful. It was easy to get the baby in and out.
customer_reviews.author: kristian

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot speak highly enough of this carrier! My kiddo is 6 months old and practically since birth has hated inward facing carriers. If she's sleepy she will let me wear her that way but she certainly prefers to be outward facing so she can see and explore her surroundings. I had the original Ergo and was unable to use very much for this reason. We decided to splurge on this one for vacation and I'm SO glad we did. I wore her in the airport, on the beach, on walks, etc.. She seemed super content and comfortable every time she was in this thing. I would most definitely recommend this over the Original; it's worth the additional cost!
customer_reviews.author: JayAR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I received the original Ergo carrier Karin Frost Design Limited edition hand me down from my sister and love it. Decided to purchase the 360 to try it out and I love it even more than my original. The thick straps help support my 6month-20lb baby VERY comfortably in all directions without digging into my bones or hurting my back since I have a small frame/build at 110lb and am 5'0 tall. Withoug this carrier I couldnt get stuff done around the house! Regardless of the price you pay,or the fabric pattern you choose, i recomend this product 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Best carrier in the long wrong
customer_reviews.text: Great carrier for bigger babies. I had the baby bjorn with my first 12 years ago. I also tried the Kayan. This offers much better back support. I was a lot more comfortable walking around with her in this. It’s very easy once you get used to it. I watched the YouTube video a couple of times, and had it down in 5 min. I waited and watched and was able to get it for 90.00. It was a great buy! I used it at a ball game the other day and it was totally worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: LexxyZ82

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This baby carrier is classy looking yet functional. We purchased the additional newborn insert so that it could be used while he was very little (if you baby is close to 10 pounds you probably don’t need the insert). It has multiple neck support positions and a canopy that rolls up into a pocket. The only downside is that it gets hot for the baby in the summer because of the thick material needed to make it structurally supportive. I use this in stores, outside doing chores, and to calm him when he’s being extra fussy.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Favorite carrier, a must have for every mom!
customer_reviews.text: I tried and returned a lot of carriers. And this is the best carrier, the fabric is soft and padded for both positions and I feel like it can support my son that’s 20 pounds. He’s starting to become to heavy for long periods of time but its great for shopping and when he was smaller. It took some getting used to, to buckle the back shoulder strap, someone who is not very flexible would have a hard time. I wish there was a way to redesign that part. I have black which shows lint and drool but it’s easy to clean with a wet cloth
customer_reviews.author: Brittany DaRe

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I have tried the wraps and another carrier, but this is the only one that did not hurt my back. I injured my back during pregnancy and my physical therapist recommended I buy this brand since it is actually ergonomic. It works and I have no back pain while using this. I love all the extra safety loops and buckles. Many other cheaper carriers do not have this feature. This was worth the investment to me
customer_reviews.author: AReyOfSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace and incredibly uncomfortable infantino and it worked out perfectly. This carrier is SO much more comfortable and actually holds our sons legs up so he doesn’t lose circulation. So far it’s amazing and I love it. The shoulder straps are pretty darn comfortable and the lumbar support is great as well. I’m really glad the upper back clip has a little more wiggle room than our old one so it’s actually on our back rather than neck. Very durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: xNecro Queenx

customer_reviews.title: Best baby item purchase
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this carrier and I am so glad I purchased it! I was hesitant because of the price, but it's rated #1 for a reason. So far, we've only used the front facing position with the infant insert for my 6-week-old. She falls asleep after being in it for only a few minutes and she loves being close to mommy. It is very comfortable for us both. We plan to use this for hiking trips in the future, so I'm glad it is ergonomic for baby's hips. I wish it had a pocket for a phone, keys, etc. so it could truly be hands free. I ordered a small pocket wallet with a clip as a substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this carrier with the newborn insert for my daughter, so that we could still go on outings with my toddler. I even put him in it for fun and he fit comfortably and we laughed because hes 3 feet tall and almost 30 lbs. I'm excited to have this as she grows. So far loving it. I dont have a hard time latching the top buckle like others have said. Baby seems comfortable, and my back feels better than when I use baby wraps. She did get pretty sweaty in there and it was a cool day.. that would be my only setback.
customer_reviews.author: Emalie

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for a better carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for a better carrier. Our little one loves this and regularly falls asleep in it. I take him to work at my office and this makes a great way for me to keep him happy and get work done. I also love the versatility of it. I can't wait till our little guy is a little bigger so I can put him on my back! The only thing that might make this better is if their were pockets in the carrier, or the ability to add one as an attachment of some sort. I'm very happy with this purchase and would recommend it to anyone wanting wear their baby!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Abbott

customer_reviews.title: The price was pretty high, but the straps and waist band are ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this baby carrier out of many other brands because my baby had a hip displacement (DDH) from birth. She took off the harness after 8 weeks, but my husband and I are still careful with her hip and legs. Upon researching for quite a while, I learned that Ergobaby carrier has wide seating area, which makes my baby's legs to spread apart (safe for the babies with DDH). The price was pretty high, but the straps and waist band are very strong, which holds my baby safely. I'm very satisfied with the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Lj

customer_reviews.title: I love it! Been using it since my son was ...
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to have any issues while using this carrier! I love it! Been using it since my son was a new born. My only request is a pocket or pouch on the front, other wise it's great! It's simple enough to put on alone unless I want to put my 1 yr old son on my back and I would prefer assistance. This was great to use especially when he was only a few months old and I was in the stores vs using the car seat in the cart which doesn't leave much space for groceries or other items. Great support, shoulder straps very comfortable and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: kakes

customer_reviews.title: So Cute!
customer_reviews.text: I had an infantino carrier that I loved but was stolen and decided to opt for an ergo instead. I love it! The pattern is adorable, it’s super comfy (I’m a petite 5’3”), and my 7 month old loves it. A little on the pricey side but I should be able to use it for future kiddos and think it was a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: ... crisscross in the back carrier before buy this and loved it until my son got heavy and the carrier ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a crisscross in the back carrier before buy this and loved it until my son got heavy and the carrier would hurt my back. Notice the difference as soon as I used this one! Life changing and worth every penny! My suggestion to pregnant moms is to buy a cheaper one at first and see if you truly use a carrier. If you do then upgrade to this one. i know a lot of people that bought this one and turns out they don't use a carrier that often.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler The French Woman

customer_reviews.title: I had a cloth wrap (I think it was called a molby) anyway I always felt like it wasn't going to hold the baby plus the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptic of this after a friend bought one. My first reaction is "I would NEVER spend $150.00 on a baby carrier"...until I bought mine. It was a lifesaver. I had a cloth wrap (I think it was called a molby) anyway I always felt like it wasn't going to hold the baby plus the fact that it was hot to wear. I purchased the Ergobaby carrier with the intention of returning it. I promised my friend I would try it. I can vouch when I say it was the best $150 I've spent!!! Definitely worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Luna

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put on alone
customer_reviews.text: Its not bad nothing digs into skin or anything so its super comfortable. I just dont like that its almost impossible to put on alone i have to put the baby in laying down on the bed and then do the waist belt clip the arm parts and slide in and then i can stand up straight it’s ridiculous. Other than that its not bad really wish it had pockets bc it would be easier to store my phone and stuff instead of having to get it from bag
customer_reviews.author: johana

customer_reviews.title: Believe the Hype.
customer_reviews.text: One of my top 5 baby buys. I looooooove this carrier! I had an Evenflo carrier and it killed my trap muscles. I would be sooooo sore after an hour with a 10 lb baby. I couldn't believe the difference with the Ergo. The straps are super comfy and the buckles on the back really help distribute the weight. I love how simple it is to switch positions. This carrier is so well designed. I've washed it and air line dried it and it still looks like new. I recommend it to all new moms now!
customer_reviews.author: DeathByARabbit

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a new carrier because one that was gifted to me was getting uncomfortable (infantino). I was hesitant to pay the more expensive price when I could’ve gotten another infantino for 50 bucks less. But as soon as I put the ergo on I was hooked! Sooo much more comfortable, no shoulder pain like before! I am so happy and would buy this again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our 10 month old who always has to be facing out. Haven't really gotten to try it with her on my back, but the front carry has been very comfortable and she seems to love it. I bought this to replace our Baby Bjorn because she was getting bigger, and I do miss how easy and quick that one was to put on. I have also been able to nurse her in the 360 carrier while hiking and it works well while trying to do chores around the house so I can have two hands.
customer_reviews.author: bigs024

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: What a waste. Must be fastened in the back. Impossible to safely fasten by oneself. The baby is bound to fall out in the process. Someone else needs to fasten it, but the purpose of the carrier is to carry the baby when there's no one else around.
customer_reviews.author: Colibri

customer_reviews.title: ... through many carriers and this is by far my favorite. It is very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 children and have been through many carriers and this is by far my favorite. It is very comfortable. Even after wearing it for a few hours I am not in pain in my back or shoulders. My baby also loves this one the best. I only gave it four stars because I wish it had a small pocket and the velcro is so loud. I have learned to just keep the carrier on if I take my baby out and he stays asleep. I don't have any problems putting this on by myself. It's really the best carrier I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: MHam

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few Carriers and this one is the best so far. Versatile (different positions for all ages), Easy to use, Comfortable for my baby and myself. The fabric is soft and I have washed it in the washing machine and the carrier held up well. I debated for months to buy because of the price. It is on the pricey end but I think its one of those products that is worth the cost. Glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: empen

customer_reviews.title: Yes, get it
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, you need a carrier that the baby can face forward. My babies always loved facing out to see everything. They would get frustrated being smashed against me once they are a certain age. I do wish there was a pocket to carry keys and other small items. I don't mind the Velcro as other users have said. You can easily take your baby out without undoing the Velcro. Its also very easy to get baby in. And my back never hurts as with other carriers I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: laura pelow

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier. I've tried several other, cheaper carriers and this one is by far superior. It's comfortable and baby likes it. So far, it's not the easiest to get on, but I'll probably get better with it. For that reason and the cost, I didn't give a full 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Salo

customer_reviews.title: Best baby product
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this. Best thing I ever bought for my baby. He's about 25 pounds and this really takes the weigh away and I can hold him longer and it's more comfortable than just holding him with my arms. I love this and he loves being carried in it too! I use this to go out or what I do everyday is I use this to carry him on my back and put him to sleep. Works so well!!! Can't say enough good things about this.
customer_reviews.author: Eric barreto

customer_reviews.title: Good for multiple sizes
customer_reviews.text: Our colicy baby basically lives in the ergo. It's about the only way we can get him to sleep well during the day. My husband likes to come home and kangaroo with him in the 360. Adjusting straps between our sizes is easy, and even major adjustments (such as for my 6'4", 270 lb dad) aren't too too crazy. I am very glad we bought the infant insert to give the 360 an extra long life, and that our baby likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Addy

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lifesaver! I used this for our infant when I needed to get some housework done. It saves your back when you can't use a stroller. It is easy to use and adjust. My husband and I use the same one and it can be adjusted in less than a minute. The product seems durable and designed well! Simple to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Erica M.

customer_reviews.title: Slightly better than Boba, I think
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband who hated the Boba. The setup is similar, except the waistband on the Ergo is Velcro. I think I may start using this over Boba because it has better head support for baby and her weight seems more evenly distributed, so she feels lighter in this. No infant insert included as with the Boba, so I deducted a star
customer_reviews.author: Gradgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great, versitle carrier
customer_reviews.text: We love our Ergobaby carrier. Having the flexibility to carry a baby 4 different ways is fantastic and really allows the carrier to grow with your little one and be versitle for different types of outings. The built in rain/sun hood is great. It's also stylish and comfortable to wear. I don't know how this compares to other carriers size wise, but it is a little bulky. Luckily when flying I wear this through the airport, but if you were hoping to pack it it would take up quite a bit of space in your suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Molly R

customer_reviews.title: I am so glad that I have purchased this carrier
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that I have purchased this carrier. It has been extremely helpful in showing the baby around (when facing outwards) and in helping my baby fall asleep (when facing inwards). The common complain on the noise of the Velcro has not been an issue, because 1) you can always untie yourself in another room after you putting the sleeping baby down and 2) babies adapt to new sounds quickly and mine doesn't show the surprising face the second time I untie in front of her.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Nashi

customer_reviews.title: I find this to be horribly uncomfortable, cumbersome/bulky and really hard on my back
customer_reviews.text: Despite adjusting this several times and ensuring I am wearing it properly, I find this to be horribly uncomfortable, cumbersome/bulky and really hard on my back. I prefer a basic wrap 10 fold to this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever
customer_reviews.text: Best investment ever! Worth every single dollar! I have gone through 2 baby carriers (the infantino and some other generic crap) and the ergo sling, but I have to say the best one is the ergo baby carrier. Mommy and baby boy loves it!! The advantages are endless!!!!: Mommy loves her back not hurting the next day, Baby loves been carried around watching everything sitting comfortable, the fabric is soft and comfortable, you can actually get things done because you have free hands and no crying baby!!!. The only downside is that I wish it had like a little zip pocket to put my cell phone. I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: XxTanBabexX

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this carrier!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my daughter. She opened it the day it came and used it immeadiately. She raved about how comfortable it was to wear and her baby loves it. She did go online and viewed a you tube video on how to use it. She said the video was very helpful and gave her several tips on the using the carrier. She was able to secure the carrier without any assistance after viewing the video. I just purchased the bib and stap protectors to use with the carrier since her baby immeadiately started chewing on the straps. Even if the cost goes up a little, I think the these items should come standard with the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: D Web

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. I use it to show my friends on Instagram how to do at home workouts during this Covid 19 quarantine. I can squat with my baby, do dishes with my baby, and so much more! I highly recommend this item. Ps if you’re in need of at home workouts, follow me @anniebabyworkouts!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable leg room for tiny legs
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier because it allows my baby to let her legs hang naturally as oppose to having her stretch her legs out. Other carriers that I bought (Boba) would make it so uncomfortable for her because her tiny legs couldn't get through. My 4 1/2 month would get fussy in the evening at I would just put her in here while I did housework and she seemed very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A.P

customer_reviews.title: Both my son and I love this one!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second ergo (have also had a mint wrap and petunia pickle bottom carrier)...I love that my son can be carried many different ways. He loved to be carried facing forward. I am not a small woman but I have narrow shoulders so this works very nicely for me. My husband will also wear it! I hope it works for hikes this summer but I am afraid my son and whoever is carrying him (hopefully my husband) will get too warm. I hope not since we finally found something he likes.
customer_reviews.author: Sara C

customer_reviews.title: The only carrier I can use...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only baby carrier that I’ve ever actually used a lot. I’ve have a couple other basic ones, but they were so uncomfortable, I couldn’t keep them on. I’m short and very small and the weight of the others was painfully distributed. Not so with this carrier. I can wear it for hours! And my baby loves it. I’m using it with the infant carrier as well and it’s perfect. It’s so simple and quick to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this baby carrier for about two months and LOVE IT! My daughter gets tired of the stroller and she just doesn't get enough of being carried on me. I have taken her (14.5 pounds) facing frontward on long and steep hikes. When she gets tired I just turn her around. It's pricy but I really do feel that it is worth it. I had an inexpensive one and it hurt my back and shoulders terribly. I literally have no pain with this one. It's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Brianne Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Harsh fabric, forward position between legs too wide
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is too rough for a baby, it never was comfortable for my baby, she's now 11 months and this carrier continues to disappoint. Not only is the fabric too harsh but the forward facing position is too wide, my baby is in the 95 percentile and this darn carrier never worked. My baby always ends up getting a horrible rash, even bruises her delicate skin. Please save your money.
customer_reviews.author: naomi

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. Maybe better for men.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: My daughter's legs always seemed awkwardly placed. I was worried about her hips being sprawled out so far apart. She's 18lbs. The strap around the waist is a huge velcro contraption that is a bit much. I hated taking it off in quit places. It's quiet the attention getter with all the nose it makes taking it off. I'm about a size 8 so that's a lot of velcro to take off. Pros: It is however easy to take her in and out with the shoulder straps. Feels secure once it's on. Wish I would have got the rain coat to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I love this thing. It would have gotten five stars if it had a small pocket for me to slide my keys, cell phone, or a few dollars. It's cumbersome to carry my son in this and a whole purse. Wish it had a small pocket, but other than that I love it. I wish I had bought it sooner. It has definitely made my life easier. p.s. The buckle behind your shoulders is definitely hard to buckle on your own. You might need help. Another reason it has four stars instead of five. I still love it though.
customer_reviews.author: happymama

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is so comfortable! It doesn't hurt your back or waist. Our baby loves to walk around the neighbourhood in it. The only hard part is to fasten the back clip. My husband doesn't have a problem with it, but my arms are not that flexible so usually it takes a few tries to do it when I'm on my own with the baby. Luckily my son finds it very funny and laughs!
customer_reviews.author: Letty

customer_reviews.title: Great for a while...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for us when my baby was between 3 and 6 months. After that it became uncomfortable on my back. It seemed as though my baby outgrew this carrier after that time though even though she is not a big baby (50th percentile weight & height). Carrier says it can hold up to 35 lbs but I'm not so sure about that. We've recently switched to the Kinderpack and are happy with that now.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel McLoughlin

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT. The baby is SO calm in it
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 5 months old and i've used this carrier almost from birth (with the newborn insert). I LOVE IT. The baby is SO calm in it, she usually falls right to sleep on walks or when i'm running around the house taking care of housework. We've flown twice since she was born, once with just me and the baby, and I don't think we would have made it through the airport without the Ergobaby. It's so sturdy, easy to put on one-handed, and very obviously secure and safe for the baby. I can't recommend this enough. I was initially uneasy about the price, but it's money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Jess P

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable carrier worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We were gifted a cheaper carrier that was really hurting my back. A few folks recommended the Ergo so I found a deal through Amazon's Open Box pricing. It is a much better carrier for both baby and I. The waist band is plenty big and supports the weight of the kiddo, and their butts and hips are more supported by the seat. He tends to fall asleep once in because he's so close to mom. It's a life saver on those fussy days when they won't let you put them down.
customer_reviews.author: KRu

customer_reviews.title: Ergo rocks!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people recommended the Ergo to me. I put it off for a while but this one was a good price finally. I figured why not get one then. I love mine I’ve never baby wore before and I have now 3 kids. After using this I wish I had. It’s very easy to put on and take off. Holds my son good and comfortable so he can sleep while we’re shopping or at the mall walking around etc.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: BULKY
customer_reviews.text: I like how versatile this carrier is (front facing, normal carry, and back carry). However this carrier always hurts my hips and feels awkward on the straps because it’s bulky. Plus I’m always fighting with clipping the straps on my back. I also got the black one so lint is very visible on it. It gets the job done when I NEED to use it. I really wanted to love this carrier but unfortunately I don’t. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and I love the variety of positions. I started off with a Moby a ring wrap. So happy to have this carrier. It is not as bulky as the Baby Bjorn carrier. I don't know why so many people complain about the sound of the Velcro... I would expect Velcro to make sounds. I didn't have any problems reaching back to clip the straps. I would recommend you loosen the strap, clip it, then adjust the strap for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Achilles

customer_reviews.title: Great for doing errands! Easy use!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to carry by 1 year old around the house when I have to do errands. He is nice and quiet in this because he gets to be next to me. Otherwise, he is crawling everywhere so I can’t get anything done.
customer_reviews.author: NNguyen

customer_reviews.title: Love this more than the original (which I used exclusively ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this more than the original (which I used exclusively with my daughter until she turned 8 months old). This seems sturdier than the original and I love how it feels when I wear it. I hope it lasts...But so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: ggs1990

customer_reviews.title: Love this carrier
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this carrier. I have tried other carriers and it felt like the baby was going to fall out. I feel like they are always very secure in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the lilebaby carrier and returned it to purchase this one. I love that the support belt around your waist isn't super stiff so you can sit and bend comfortably also this is super easy to nurse In I LOVE It! Only downside is I wish it came in cute designs like the other carriers
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with infants
customer_reviews.text: Ergobaby makes good baby carriers. However, this one doesn't work with newborn babies. You should check out other Ergobaby models if you're looking for one for newborns.
customer_reviews.author: Kam S.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and versatile. As with other reviewers my few grips are just the back straps being slightly unreadable and the waste velcrow being pretty long making it hard to make it snug. But those are pretty minor in comparison to what this carrier does overall.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing carrier. Great for every day use at the store!
customer_reviews.text: I take this everywhere with me! I got the infant insert and used it til about 5 months! It is wonderful for when I go grocery shopping and need two hands to push the cart. Also great for hiking! Definitely give this 5 stars! We love it!
customer_reviews.author: lastingmemories.byellen

customer_reviews.title: baby likes it
customer_reviews.text: our baby loves this carrier. When facing front, she loves to interact with everyone and is happy with the comfort. When facing toward me, she is relaxed and usually falls asleep. We have not use it to carry her on her back. But happy with the way this looks, functions and baby girl loves it so what else can you ask for. Only complaint is that shoulder securing clip is difficult to clip on when doing by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Collins

customer_reviews.title: The ERGO is great, but it doesn't fit all body types - ...
customer_reviews.text: The ERGO is great, but it doesn't fit all body types - I'm fairly petite (5'2, 115 lb) and it's just too wide for my frame. I highly recommend trying it with the baby at a store before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Bananaslugirl

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for sure
customer_reviews.text: We have the baby bjorn miracle carrier and it Was weird bc my baby’s legs were hanging straight down. This one is perfect for his legs- he’s in the perfect position and it’s so comfortable for me to wear
customer_reviews.author: Rinks

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic and baby likes it
customer_reviews.text: I was not disappointed by this carrier. It is ergonomic and I do not have any back aches from carrying my 4-month old baby. she likes the facing out position very much. As any carrier, it tends to keep baby and mama warm, which can be a disadvantage in warm summer temps, but overall is not overly warm. The only cons are that it is a little pricey and that putting it on may require some help.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: it was not comfortable at all
customer_reviews.text: I always concer about the price too high! But it’s really worth it! I bought a one cost $38 before, it was not comfortable at all, it was hurting my back and shoulder so bad! This time I made good choice ! It expensive for a reason! Excited about my next good trip ! Yah. Update:my baby just too heave to use this (27pounds), I use my stroller instead during my whole trip since I stay home a lot
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: I love the older versions
customer_reviews.text: I love the older versions. The color is nice, but it is very hard to get baby into. In the old models you could strap yourself in and then slip baby in from the side. With this, you have to put it on and drag baby through the bottom with one hand while you old it open with the other. It doesnt feel safe when I put her in. I've been online looking for other ways to do it and haven't found any. I love this brand, but wish I had ordered the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Amie

customer_reviews.title: We love this carrier
customer_reviews.text: We love this carrier! We got it when baby was 8 months old, so we never used the infant insert. I wish we had gotten this months ago since our son wanted to be held all the time. I could never get the hang of the moby wrap. I am 5-4 and husband 6-1, both of average weights, and it fits us comfortably. I'm only giving this 4/5 stars because it is hard to buckle in the back by myself, but i can still get it. Great carrier!
customer_reviews.author: BF16

customer_reviews.title: it went on easily and baby and I were both very comfortable in ...
customer_reviews.text: After doing a quick video review of how to put the carrier on, it went on easily and baby and I were both very comfortable in it. It feels really secure and does not put pressure on my back. The ability to switch front facing and back facing is the best part about the carrier. It suits the changing needs of my baby. She's a small 6 month old and fits well in this carrier, without sinking down like she does in some of the others I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Navjeet H.

customer_reviews.title: Have not been able to fully use the product as ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not been able to fully use the product as our first baby is not due till July. However tried this on with friend newborn infant and was instantly impressed. It so evenly distributes out the weight that you feel as if you just have a hoodie/light jacket on. My husband was also impressed and said it was a carrier that he would wear.
customer_reviews.author: mmk

customer_reviews.title: support very well!
customer_reviews.text: the must have when you have a baby! I use it everyday and does not feel painful anymore. Hope I had it 5 years ago when taking care of the first baby.
customer_reviews.author: Bertha

customer_reviews.title: MOST COMFORTABLE CARRIER FOR BABY AND DAD.
customer_reviews.text: We tried several carriers and liked this one the best. The only negative is that it takes 2 people to clip and unclip the back strap.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda G.

customer_reviews.title: Price sucks, but worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: We tried the others, and then sucked it up and spent the money on this. With all of its points of adjustment, and the seating space, this carrier was the carrier to rule them all.
customer_reviews.author: CookieJess

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 4 different carriers and this is my favorite one! I still use the original carrier at home, but when we go out, this one is in the car. It is so much more comfortable around the waist. The velcro didn't bother me, you just get good at adjusting it before baby is in. The back snap also became something I learned how to do more efficiently each time. My child doesn't really enjoy forward facing or back carrying but when I have used either positions it has been fine. I wish I would have bought it sooner and not hesitating purchasing because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sash

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier. I will warn you that this one is extremely warm...so if you have a hot baby or a warm blooded partner who wears the baby...they will sweat. We got the cool mesh one, but still love this carrier. I tried the LillieBaby, Moby, Boba...and this one won.
customer_reviews.author: SNorris14

customer_reviews.title: Great support for baby and person using it
customer_reviews.text: Best baby carrier out there hands down! My baby actually likes to sit on this carrier for long periods of time. customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, wish it didn't have velcro
customer_reviews.text: Great carrier, great quality, but I could not stand the wide belt and velcro so I had to return. I didn't like that because it was velcro you can not adjust it while wearing it and that the velcro sticks to/could ruin clothes.
customer_reviews.author: KBD87

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!

customer_reviews.title: Offers lots of support for mom and baby
customer_reviews.text: This is the only carrier that I feel comfortable using for forward facing. It offers great support for the legs. We use it all the time. We also have a tule but I used the Ergo more when my son was little. I love all the options it has. The roll up hood it very nice. Wide belt makes it comfortable for your back. My son loved facing forward in this.
customer_reviews.author: The Manuels

customer_reviews.text: Now that I figured out how to put it on and get my baby in and out I love it. It is not as self explanatory as the Baby Bjorn but it is much more comfortable especially for prolonged wear. I carried my 5 month old around Walt Disney World for 4 days- he weighs 16lbs and we walked about 8 miles a day. No pain between my shoulder blades or lower back like when I use the Bjorn. I'd certainly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: A great carrier

The only downside is that if my child fell asleep while being carried, the sound of the Velcro belt would wake them up. If I was loading them into the car I would make sure to put them in the car seat and once they’re buckled up, I would close the door and then undo the Velcro belt so they didn’t get startled.

customer_reviews.title: I love my ergo baby carrier
customer_reviews.text: I love my ergo baby carrier. after reading about other carriers and them potentially causing your baby hip problems I bought this one. not only is it better for baby's hips but its much more comfy for them and it does hurt my back as much as the other carriers. my only complaint is that the black material attracts a lot of lint. but than can be easily fixed with a lint brush.
customer_reviews.author: JBUG

customer_reviews.title: This carrier is great! My baby seems very comfortable in it and ...
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is great! My baby seems very comfortable in it and I like that it offers a variety of positions. The zipper pocket up front is very convenient! I throw my ID and debit card in there so when we grocery shop I don't have to bring my purse inside. The only downside is that the material that wraps around your waist is very thick and causes me to get very hot while wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: For babies that want to see the world!
customer_reviews.text: This is such an awesome carrier. It's one of the only carriers that allows you to carry an infant in a forward facing position, which is absolutely the ONLY way my baby wants to be carried. Most other carriers require the baby to weigh much more before he or she can be facing outwards. Its very comfortable to wear. I wish the wasteband wasnt velcro though because its noisy and if i need to tighten it i have to undo the velcro and re-do it. This carrier is still worth it though because you know you are getting a safe and ergonomically healthy carrier for baby...and you can carry baby FACING OUT!
customer_reviews.author: LoveBingMom

customer_reviews.title: We used it for flying which was wonderful as well I use it primarily as a back ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 14 mo. and she loves it. We used it for flying which was wonderful as well I use it primarily as a back pack for her. She seems to be very comfortable, it's comfortable for me. The only thing I would say it its very bulky. When I needed to take it off it really doesn't fit well in a back pack, purse, baby bag, etc,. I wish they would make a bag with a pull string to put it in.

customer_reviews.title: Much Better than Bjorn

I also feel it’s easier to get on (that might be personal preference) and it feels much snugger on my chest. We use it every day and the baby loves it!

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever

Dear Husband has very broad shoulders and other carriers dug into his shoulders too much, but this has the perfect amount of padding to keep him and baby comfortable for hours. Also, baby's hips are well supported, and appreciates being able to see the world facing forward.
customer_reviews.author: EVM

customer_reviews.title: Love the 360

I wouldn't recommend wearing a toddler while pregnant though, gave me crazy back pain and my bump was not having it either.

product_meta.description: Color:Pure BlackExplore with curious, developing older babies in the Ergobaby's 360 baby carrier. Ergobaby’s award-winning 360 baby carrier ergonomically supports baby in four convenient carry positions (inward, forward, hip & back) from baby to toddler (4-48 months; 12-45lbs). The 100% cotton fabric is soft and cozy for the ultimate in plush comfort. The carrier easily adjusts to fit petite to larger body types, and the lumbar support waistbelt provides the lower back support you need. Includes UPF baby hood for sun protection, privacy and easy breastfeeding. Ergobaby stands by our products with our ErgoPromise Guarantee.
